rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;Earnings per share &amp;#8211; diluted&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td colspan=2 style=vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#e0e3f1;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px; rowspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;4.14&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#e0e3f1; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td colspan=2 style=vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px; rowspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;3.46&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;These unaudited pro forma consolidated results are not adjusted for changes in the business that will take place subsequent to our acquisition
 including
 but not limited to
 additional transaction and integration costs that may be incurred. Accordingly
 the above unaudited pro forma results are not necessarily indicative of the results that actually would have occurred if the acquisition had been completed as of December 1
 2015
 nor are they indicative of future consolidated results.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;text-decoration:underline;&gt;Other Acquisitions&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;On May 5
 2017
 we purchased the remaining &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;15%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; ownership interest in our joint venture
 Kohinoor Specialty Foods India Private Limited (Kohinoor) in India for a cash payment of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$1.6 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 of which &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$1.2 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; was paid in 2017 and the balance is expected to be paid in the fourth quarter of 2018. In September 2011
 when we originally entered this joint venture
 we invested &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$113.0 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; for an 85% interest in Kohinoor. In conjunction with our purchase of the &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;15%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; minority interest in 2017
 we have eliminated the minority interest in Kohinoor and recorded an adjustment of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$0.6 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; in retained earnings of our shareholders' equity section of our consolidated balance sheet. The &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$1.2 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; payment is reflected in the financing activities section of our consolidated cash flow statement for 2017.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;On December 15
 2016
 we purchased 100% of the shares of Enrico Giotti SpA (Giotti)
 a leading European flavor manufacturer located in Italy
 for a purchase price of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$123.8 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; (net of cash acquired of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$1.2 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;)
 including the effect of a &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$0.2 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; favorable net working capital adjustment. The acquisition was funded with cash and short-term borrowings. Giotti is well known in the industry for its innovative beverage
 sweet
 savory and dairy flavor applications. At the time of the acquisition
 annual sales of Giotti were approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#8364;53 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;. Our acquisition of Giotti in fiscal 2017 expands the breadth of value-added products for McCormick's industrial segment
 including additional expertise in flavoring health and nutrition products. During 2017
 we completed the final valuation of the acquired net assets of Giotti that resulted in&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$7.0 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#160;allocated to net tangible assets acquired
&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$4.8 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; allocated to indefinite lived brand asset
&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$31.5 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#160;allocated to definite-lived intangible assets with a weighted-average life of&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;11.9 years&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#160;and&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$80.5 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#160;allocated to goodwill.&amp;#160;Goodwill related to the Giotti acquisition
 which is not deductible for tax purposes
 primarily represents the intangible assets that do not qualify for separate recognition
 such as the value of leveraging the customer intimacy and value-added flavor solutions we provide to our industrial customers to Giotti&amp;#8217;s relationships with industrial customers of their flavors solutions and extracts
 as well as from expected synergies from the combined operations and assembled workforces
 and the future development initiatives of the assembled workforces. Giotti has been included in our industrial segment since its acquisition. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;On September 1
 2016
 we acquired a small niche business for &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$4.4 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;. That business
 Cajun Injector
 whose annual sales were approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$5 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; at the time of acquisition
 sells injectable marinades
 along with seasonings and fry mixes that feature New Orleans flavors. Cajun Injector
 which has been included in our consumer segment since its acquisition
 complements our Zatarain&amp;#8217;s brand.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;On April 19
 2016
 we completed the purchase of 100% of the shares of Botanical Food Company
 Pty Ltd
 owner of the Gourmet Garden brand of packaged herbs (Gourmet Garden)
 a privately held company based in Australia. Gourmet Garden is a global market leader in chilled convenient packaged herbs. Gourmet Garden's products complement our existing branded herb portfolio with the addition of chilled convenient herbs located in the perimeter of the grocery store. We plan to drive sales of the Gourmet Garden brand by expanding global distribution and building awareness with increased brand investment. At the time of acquisition
 annual sales of Gourmet Garden were approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;70 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; Australian dollars. The purchase price was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$116.2 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 net of cash acquired of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$3.3 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and after closing adjustments
 and was financed with a combination of cash and short-term borrowings. That purchase price reflects a &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$1.9 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; favorable net working capital adjustment that was received in the third quarter of 2016. During 2017
 we completed the final valuation of the Gourmet Garden acquisition which resulted in the following changes from the preliminary valuation to the acquired assets and liabilities: (i) the indefinite-lived brand asset increased by &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$7.3 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$27.6 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;; (ii) definite-lived intangible assets increased by &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$4.7 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$18.9 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; (with a weighted-average life of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;14.2 years&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;); (iii) net tangible assets (net of liabilities assumed
 including the deferred tax liabilities associated with identified intangible assets) acquired decreased by &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$4.4 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$16.0 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;; (iv) goodwill decreased by &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$7.6 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$53.7 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;. There was no material change to amortization expense as a result of these changes in the final valuation. Goodwill related to the Gourmet Garden acquisition
 which is not deductible for tax purposes
 primarily represents the intangible assets that do not qualify for separate recognition
 such as the value of leveraging our brand-building expertise
 our insights in demand from consumers for herbs
 and our supply chain capabilities
 as well as expected synergies from the combined operations and assembled workforce. Gourmet Garden has been included in our consumer segment since its acquisition. While this business has an industrial component
 the industrial component was not material to its overall business in 2016. Beginning in 2017
 the industrial component of Gourmet Garden is being reflected as a component of our industrial segment. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;On August 20
 2015
 we completed the purchase of 100% of the shares of One World Foods
 Inc.
 owner of the Stubb's brand of barbeque products (Stubb's)
 a privately held company located in Austin
 Texas. Stubb's is a leading premium barbeque sauce brand in the U.S. In addition to sauces
 Stubb's products include marinades
 rubs and skillet sauces. Its addition expanded the breadth of value-added products in our consumer segment. At the time of acquisition
 annual sales of Stubb's were approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$30 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;. The purchase price for Stubb's was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$99.4 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 net of cash acquired of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$0.8 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 and was financed with a combination of cash and short-term borrowings. During 2016
 we completed the final valuation of the Stubb's acquisition
 which resulted in the following changes from the preliminary valuation to the acquired assets and liabilities: (i) the indefinite-lived brand asset increased by &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$13.8 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$27.1 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;; (ii) definite-lived intangible assets increased by &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$11.9 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$24.4 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; (with a weighted-average life of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;13.9 years&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;); (iii) tangible assets acquired increased by &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$0.3 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$5.7 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;; (iv) liabilities assumed (including the deferred tax liabilities associated with identified intangible assets) increased by &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$7.0 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$19.4 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;; and (v) goodwill decreased by &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$19.0 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$61.6 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;. As a result of these changes in the final valuation
 additional amortization expense for definite-lived intangible assets of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$0.9 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; was recorded for the year ended November 30
 2016. Goodwill related to the Stubb's acquisition
 which is not deductible for tax purposes
 primarily represents the intangible assets that do not qualify for separate recognition
 such as the value of leveraging our brand building expertise
 our insights in demand from consumers for unique and authentic barbeque and grilling flavors
 and our supply chain capabilities
 as well as expected synergies from the combined operations and assembled workforce. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;On May 29
 2015
 we completed the purchase of 100% of the shares of Drogheria &amp;amp; Alimentari (D&amp;amp;A)
 a privately held company based in Italy
 and a leader of the spice and seasoning category in Italy that supplies both branded and private label products to consumers. This acquisition complemented our strong brands and expanded our current spice and seasoning leadership in Europe with a sizable footprint in Italy. The purchase price for D&amp;amp;A consisted of a cash payment of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$49.0 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 net of cash acquired of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$2.8 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 and was financed with a combination of cash and short-term borrowings. In addition
 the purchase agreement called for a potential earn out payment in 2018 of up to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#8364;35 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 based upon the performance of the acquired business in 2017. This potential earn-out payment had an acquisition-date fair value of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$27.7 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; (or approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#8364;25 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;)
 based on estimates of projected performance in 2017 and discounted using a probability-weighted approach. During 2017
 we reached agreement with the sellers to settle the contingent consideration liability prior to its contractual term for approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$29.3 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; (&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#8364;26.1 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;)
 with &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$19.7 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; (&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#8364;17.6 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;) paid in 2017. We previously prepaid &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#8364;5.0 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; at the date of acquisition. The balance of the liability is expected to be paid early in 2018. Accordingly
 during 2017
 we recognized a &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$1.6 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; gain on settlement in selling
 general and administrative expense in our consolidated income statement. At the time of the acquisition
 annual sales of D&amp;amp;A were approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#8364;50 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;. D&amp;amp;A has been included in our consumer segment since its acquisition.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;On March 9
 2015
 we acquired 100% of the shares of Brand Aromatics
 a privately held company located in the U.S. Brand Aromatics is a supplier of natural savory flavors
 marinades
 and broth and stock concentrates to the packaged food industry. Its addition expanded the breadth of value-added products in our industrial segment. The purchase price for Brand Aromatics was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$62.4 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 net of post-closing adjustments and was financed with a combination of cash and short-term borrowings. At the time of acquisition
 annual sales of Brand Aromatics were approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$30 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;. Brand Aromatics has been included in our industrial segment since its acquisition.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;Transaction-related expenses include third party expenses related to commercial and legal due diligence for unconsummated and completed acquisitions as well as third party expenses related to accounting
 legal and financing activities with respect to completed acquisitions. Transaction-related expenses associated with the above acquisitions
 excluding amounts related to the RB Foods acquisition that are separately classified in our consolidated income statement
 are included in selling
 general and administrative expense in our consolidated income statement and totaled &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$2.9 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$5.5 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$3.6 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; for 2017
 2016 and 2015
 respectively. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;In 2017
 Giotti added &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$66.5 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and Gourmet Garden added &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$27.3 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; to our sales for the year and first four months of fiscal 2017
 respectively. Due to financing
 acquisition and integration costs

	

 we are occasionally involved with various claims and litigation. Reserves are established in connection with such matters when a loss is probable and the amount of such loss can be reasonably estimated. At &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;November 30
 2017&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;2016&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 no material reserves were recorded. The determination of probability and the estimation of the actual amount of any such loss are inherently unpredictable
 and it is therefore possible that the eventual outcome of such claims and litigation could exceed the estimated reserves
 if any. However


 net of tax where applicable (in millions):&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;div style=padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;margin-left:auto;margin-right:auto;width:99.609375%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td colspan=7 rowspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=width:70%;  but not control
 are accounted for by the equity method. Accordingly

054.0&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-left:12px;text-align:left;padding-left:20px;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=width:20px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:8pt;padding-left:-4px;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;(1)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;Interest rate swaps
 settled upon the issuance of these notes in 2007
 effectively set the interest rate on the &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;$250 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt; notes at a weighted-average fixed rate of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;6.25%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=width:20px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:8pt;padding-left:-4px;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;(2)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;As more fully described below
 the term loans are prepayable in whole or in-part. Also
 the term loan due in 2022 requires quarterly principal payments of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;2.5%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt; of the initial principal amount.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=width:20px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:8pt;padding-left:-4px;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;(3)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;Interest rate swaps
 settled upon the issuance of these notes in 2011
 effectively set the interest rate on the &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;$250 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt; notes at a weighted-average fixed rate of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;4.01%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=width:20px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:8pt;padding-left:-4px;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;(4)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;Interest rate swaps
 settled upon the issuance of these notes in 2013
 effectively set the interest rate on the &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-transform:default;&gt;$250 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt; notes at a weighted-average fixed rate of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-transform:default;&gt;3.30%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=width:20px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:8pt;padding-left:-4px;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;(5)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;Interest rate swaps
 settled upon  the issuance of these notes in 2015
 effectively set the interest rate on the &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;$250 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt; notes at a weighted-average fixed rate of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;3.45%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:8pt;&gt;. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;The fixed interest rate on &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;$100 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt; of the &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;3.25%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt; notes due in 2025 is effectively converted to a variable rate by interest rate swaps through 2025. Net interest payments are based on 3 month LIBOR plus &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;1.22%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt; during this period (our effective rate as of November&amp;#160;30
 2017 was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;2.64%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;).&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=width:20px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:8pt;padding-left:-4px;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;(6)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;Interest rate swaps
 settled upon the issuance of these notes in 2017
 effectively set the interest rate on the &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;$750 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt; notes at a weighted-average fixed rate of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;3.44%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;.  &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;Maturities of long-term debt during the fiscal years subsequent to November&amp;#160;30
 2018 are as follows (in millions):&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;div style=padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td colspan=4 rowspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=width:91%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:1%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:7%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:1%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;border-top:2px solid #00539b; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;2019&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;border-top:2px solid #00539b; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;border-top:2px solid #00539b; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;77.1&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-top:2px solid #00539b; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;2020&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td colspan=2 style=vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px; rowspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;576.8&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;2021&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td colspan=2 style=vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px; rowspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;326.8&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;2022&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td colspan=2 style=vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px; rowspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;1
182.6&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;Thereafter&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td colspan=2 style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px; rowspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;2
317.0&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;The consideration for our acquisition of RB Foods on August 17
 2017 totaled approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$4.2 billion&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; in cash (see note 2) and was funded with (a)&amp;#160;borrowings under McCormick&amp;#8217;s &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$1.5 billion&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; Term Loan Agreement described below; (b)&amp;#160;amounts received from the offering of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$2.5 billion&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; aggregate principal amount of McCormick&amp;#8217;s senior unsecured notes described below; and (c)&amp;#160;amounts received from the offering of McCormick&amp;#8217;s common stock non-voting
 which closed on August&amp;#160;11
 2017 (see note 13).&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;In connection with our entry into the agreement to acquire RB Foods
 we entered into a commitment letter
 dated July 18
 2017 (the &amp;#8220;Commitment Letter&amp;#8221;)
 under which certain banks agreed to provide a senior unsecured 364-day bridge loan facility (the &amp;#8220;Bridge Facility&amp;#8221;) of up to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$4.2 billion&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; in the aggregate. On August 7
 2017
 we entered into a Senior Unsecured Bridge Credit Agreement with certain financial institutions under which those financial institutions agreed to provide a senior unsecured 364-day bridge loan facility (the &amp;#8220;Bridge Facility&amp;#8221;) for the purpose of providing the financing necessary to fund all or a portion of the consideration to be paid pursuant to the terms of the agreement related to the acquisition of RB Foods and related fees and expenses (the &amp;#8220;Bridge Loan Commitment&amp;#8221;). The Bridge Facility provided that the Bridge Loan Commitment would be reduced in equivalent amounts upon any incurrence by McCormick of
 among other things
 term loans and/or the issuance of equity or notes in a public offering or private placement prior to the consummation of the transaction
 subject to certain exceptions set forth in the Bridge Facility. McCormick secured its permanent financing for the RB Foods acquisition
 as described above
 prior to the August 17
 2017 acquisition date. As a result
 the Bridge Loan Commitment was reduced to zero without us ever drawing under the Bridge Facility. Other debt costs of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$15.4 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; for the year ended November 30
 2017 represents the Bridge Loan Commitment financing fees.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;As previously noted
 in connection with our acquisition of RB Foods
 we entered into a Term Loan Agreement (&amp;#8220;Term Loan&amp;#8221;) in August 2017.  The Term Loan provides for &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;three&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;-year and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;five&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;-year senior unsecured term loans
 each for &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$750 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;. The net proceeds received from the issuance of the Term Loan was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$1
498.3 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;. The &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;three&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;-year loan is payable at maturity. The &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;five&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;-year loan is payable in equal quarterly installments in an amount of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;2.5%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of the initial principal amount
 with the remaining unpaid balance due at maturity. The &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;three&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;-year and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;five&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;-year loans are each prepayable in whole or in-part. During the fourth quarter of 2017
 we repaid &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$250 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of the three-year loan. The &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;three&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;-year and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;five&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;-year loans currently bear interest at LIBOR plus &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;1.125%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and LIBOR plus &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;1.25%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 respectively. The interest rates are based on our credit rating with the maximum potential interest rates of LIBOR plus &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;1.625%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and LIBOR plus &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;1.75%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; for the &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;three&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;-year loan and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;five&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;-year loan
 respectively. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;The provisions of our outstanding &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$1.0 billion&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; revolving credit facility and the Term Loan restrict subsidiary indebtedness and require us to maintain certain minimum and maximum financial ratios for interest expense coverage and our leverage ratio. The applicable leverage ratio is reduced annually commencing on November 30
 2018. As of November 30
 2017
 our capacity under the revolving credit facility is not affected by these covenants. We do not expect that these covenants would limit our access to our revolving credit facility for the foreseeable future; however
 the leverage ratio could restrict our ability to utilize this facility.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;In August 2017
 we issued an aggregate amount of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$2.5 billion&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of senior unsecured notes. These notes are due as follows: &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$750.0 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; due August 15
 2022
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$700.0 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; due August 15
 2024
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$750.0 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; due August 15
 2027 and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$300.0 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; due August 15
 2047 with stated fixed interest rates of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;2.70%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;3.15%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;3.40%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;4.20%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 respectively. Interest is payable semiannually in arrears in August and February of each year.  The net proceeds received from the issuance of these notes were &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$2
479.3 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;. The net proceeds from this issuance were used to partially fund our acquisition of RB Foods.  In addition
 we used a portion of these proceeds
 which in the interim were used to repay commercial paper borrowings
 to repay our &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$250 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;5.75%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; notes that matured on December 15
 2017.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;In November 2015
 we issued &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;$250 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;3.25%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; notes due 2025
 with net cash proceeds received of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;$246.5 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;. Interest is payable semiannually in arrears in May and November of each year. Of these notes
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;$100 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; were subject to cash flow hedges and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$100 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; to fair value hedges as further disclosed in note 7. The net proceeds from this issuance were used to pay down short-term borrowings and for general corporate purposes. In December of 2015
 proceeds from short-term borrowings were used to pay off &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$200 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;5.20%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; notes that matured in that month.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;We have available credit facilities with domestic and foreign banks for various purposes. Some of these lines are committed lines and others are uncommitted lines and could be withdrawn at various times. In August 2017
 we entered into a &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;five&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;-year &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$1.0 billion&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; revolving credit facility
 which will expire in August 2022. The current pricing for the credit facility
 on a fully drawn basis
 is LIBOR plus &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;1.25%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;. The pricing of the credit facility is based on a credit rating grid that contains a fully drawn maximum pricing of the credit facility equal to LIBOR plus &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;1.75%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;. This credit facility supports our commercial paper program and
 after &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$219.4 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; was used to support issued commercial paper
 we have &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$780.6 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of capacity at November 30
 2017. This facility replaces our prior facilities: (i) a five-year &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$750 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; revolving credit facility that was due to expire in June 2020 and (ii) a 364-day &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$250 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; revolving facility
 which we entered into in March 2017 and that was due to expire in March 2018. The pricing for the 364-day credit facility
 on a fully drawn basis
 was LIBOR plus&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;0.75%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;. In addition
 we have several uncommitted lines totaling &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$233.1 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 which have a total unused capacity at &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;November 30
 2017&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$184.1 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;. These lines by their nature can be withdrawn based on the lenders&amp;#8217; discretion. Committed credit facilities require a fee
 and commitment fees were &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$0.8 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$0.5 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; for 2017 and 2016
 respectively.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;Rental expense under operating leases (primarily buildings and equipment) was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$46.5 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; in &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;2017&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;$41.6 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; in &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;2016&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;$39.0 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; in &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;2015&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;. Future annual fixed rental payments&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;sup style=vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:6pt&gt;(1)&lt;/sup&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; for the years ending November&amp;#160;30 are as follows (in millions):&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;div style=padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td colspan=4 rowspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=width:92%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;2022&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td colspan=2 style=vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px; rowspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;16.6&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;Thereafter&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td colspan=2 style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px; rowspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;33.7&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-left:24px;text-indent:-24px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;sup style=vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:6pt&gt;(1)      &lt;/sup&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;&gt;In July 2016
 we entered into a &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;&gt;15&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;&gt;-year lease for a headquarters building in Hunt Valley
 Maryland. The lease
 which is expected to commence upon completion of building construction and fit-out
 currently scheduled for the second half of 2018
 requires monthly lease payments of approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;&gt;$0.9 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;&gt; beginning six months after lease commencement. The &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;&gt;$0.9 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;&gt; monthly lease payment is subject to adjustment after an initial &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;&gt;60&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;&gt;-month period and thereafter on an annual basis as specified in the lease agreement. In addition
 the initial &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;&gt;$0.9 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;&gt; monthly lease payment is subject to increase in the event of agreed-upon changes to specifications related to the headquarters building. We expect to consolidate our Corporate staff and certain non-manufacturing U.S. employees
 currently housed in four locations in the suburban Baltimore
 Maryland area
 to the new headquarters building. Due to uncertainty as to the exact date when the lease will commence
 these lease payments are not reflected in the preceding table of annual fixed rental payments for the years ending November 30
 2018 through 2022 and thereafter.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;At &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;November 30
 2017&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 we had guarantees outstanding of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$0.6 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; with terms of one year or less. At &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;November 30
 2017&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;2016&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 we had outstanding letters of credit&amp;#160;of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$7.3 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$7.2 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 respectively. These letters of credit typically act as a guarantee of payment to certain third parties in accordance with specified terms and conditions. The unused portion of our letter of credit facility was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$13.7 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; at &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;November 30


 including foreign currency and interest rate exposures
 which exist as part of our ongoing business operations. We do not enter into contracts for trading purposes
 nor are we a party to any leveraged derivative instrument and all derivatives are designated as hedges. We are not a party to master netting arrangements
 and we do not offset the fair value of derivative contracts with the same counterparty in our financial statement disclosures. The use of derivative financial instruments is monitored through regular communication with senior management and the use of written guidelines.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#00539b;font-weight:bold;&gt;Foreign Currency&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;We are potentially exposed to foreign currency fluctuations affecting net investments
 transactions and earnings denominated in foreign currencies. We selectively hedge the potential effect of these foreign currency fluctuations by entering into foreign currency exchange contracts with highly-rated financial institutions.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;Contracts which are designated as hedges of anticipated purchases denominated in a foreign currency (generally purchases of raw materials in U.S. dollars by operating units outside the U.S.) are considered cash flow hedges. The gains and losses on these contracts are deferred in accumulated other comprehensive income until the hedged item is recognized in cost of goods sold
 at which time the net amount deferred in accumulated other comprehensive income is also recognized in cost of goods sold. Gains and losses from contracts which are designated as hedges of assets
 liabilities or firm commitments are recognized through income
 offsetting the change in fair value of the hedged item.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;From time to time
 we enter into fair value foreign currency exchange contracts to manage exposure to currency fluctuations in certain intercompany loans between subsidiaries. The notional value of these contracts was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$281.9 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$109.9 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; at November 30
 2017 and 2016
 respectively. During fiscal years 2017 and 2016
 we recognized a &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$12.8 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; gain and a &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$3.5 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; loss
 respectively
 on the change in fair value of these contracts
 which was offset by a &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$14.1 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; loss and a &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$3.1 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; gain
 respectively
 on the change in the currency component of the underlying loans. All of the losses and the gains for both fiscal years were recognized in our consolidated income statement as other income
 net.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;At November 30
 2017
 we had foreign currency exchange contracts to purchase or sell &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$405.9 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of foreign currencies versus &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$449.2 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; at November 30
 2016. All of these contracts were designated as hedges of anticipated purchases denominated in a foreign currency or hedges of foreign currency denominated assets or liabilities. Hedge ineffectiveness was not material. At November 30
 2017
 the notional contracts that have durations of less than &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;seven&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; days that are used to hedge short-term cash flow funding was nominal. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;At November 30
 2016
 we had &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$189.4 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of notional contracts that have durations of less than seven days that are used to hedge short-term cash flow funding. The remaining contracts have durations of one to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;twelve&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; months.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#00539b;font-weight:bold;&gt;Interest Rates&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;We finance a portion of our operations with both fixed and variable rate debt instruments
 primarily commercial paper
 notes and bank loans. We utilize interest rate swap agreements to minimize worldwide financing costs and to achieve a desired mix of variable and fixed rate debt.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;During fiscal 2017
 we entered into a total of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$150 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of forward starting interest rate swap agreements to manage our interest rate risk associated with the anticipated issuance of at least &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$150 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of fixed rate notes by December 2017. The weighted average fixed rate of these agreements was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;2.45%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and was based upon the applicable U.S. LIBOR swap rate at the inception of each agreement. We cash settled these agreements upon issuance of the &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;3.40%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; fixed rate notes issued in August 2017 and made a one-time cash payment to the counterparties of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$2.9 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;. We designated these forward starting interest rate swap agreements as cash flow hedges. Upon settlement
 the loss realized was deferred in other comprehensive income and will be amortized over the life of the &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;3.40%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; fixed rate notes due August 15
 2027 as a component of interest expense. Ineffectiveness associated with these hedges was not material.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;During fiscal 2015
 we entered into a total of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$100 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of forward starting interest rate swap agreements to manage our interest rate risk associated with the anticipated issuance of fixed rate notes in November 2015. We cash settled all of these agreements
 which were designated as cash flow hedges
 for a loss of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$1.2 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; simultaneous with the issuance of the notes at an all-in effective fixed rate of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;3.45%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; on the full &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$250 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of debt. The loss on these agreements was deferred in accumulated other comprehensive income and is being amortized to increase interest expense over the life of the notes. Hedge ineffectiveness of these agreements was not material.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;In November 2015
 we entered into interest rate swap contracts for a notional amount of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$100 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; to receive interest at &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;3.25%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and pay a variable rate of interest based on three-month LIBOR plus &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;1.22%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;. We designated these swaps
 which expire in November 2025
 as fair value hedges of the changes in fair value of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$100 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of the &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$250 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;3.25%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; medium-term notes due 2025 that we issued in November 2015. Any unrealized gain or loss on these swaps was offset by a corresponding increase or decrease in the value of the hedged debt. Hedge ineffectiveness was not material.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;The following tables disclose the derivative instruments on our balance sheet
 all of which are all recorded at fair value:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;div style=padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td colspan=15 rowspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=width:22%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:13%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:1%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:11%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:1%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:1%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:11%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:1%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:13%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:1%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:11%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:1%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:1%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:11%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:1%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#e0e3f1;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;As of&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;November&amp;#160;30
 2017:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#e0e3f1;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td colspan=3 style=vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#e0e3f1;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px; rowspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td colspan=3 style=vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#e0e3f1;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px; rowspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#e0e3f1;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td colspan=3 style=vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#e0e3f1;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px; rowspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td colspan=3 style=vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#e0e3f1;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px; rowspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;background-color:#e0e3f1;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;(millions)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td colspan=7 style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;background-color:#e0e3f1;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px; rowspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:center;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;Asset Derivatives&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td colspan=7 style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;background-color:#e0e3f1;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px; rowspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:center;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;Liability Derivatives&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:1px solid #00539b;background-color:#e0e3f1;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;
