rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td colspan=2 style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;background-color:#e0e3f1;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px; rowspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;57.4&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;background-color:#e0e3f1; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td colspan=2 style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px; rowspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;76.0&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;The accumulated benefit obligation is the present value of pension benefits (whether vested or unvested) attributed to employee service rendered before the measurement date and based on employee service and compensation prior to that date. The accumulated benefit obligation differs from the projected benefit obligation in that it includes no assumption about future compensation or service levels. The accumulated benefit obligation for the U.S. pension plans was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$797.6 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;$674.9 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; as of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;November 30
 2017&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;2016&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 respectively. The accumulated benefit obligation for the international pension plans was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$317.2 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;$296.9 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; as of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;November 30
 2017&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;2016&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 respectively.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;The investment objectives of the defined benefit pension plans are to provide assets to meet the current and future obligations of the plans at a reasonable cost to us. The goal is to optimize the long-term return across the portfolio of investments at a moderate level of risk. Higher-returning assets include mutual
 co-mingled and other funds comprised of equity securities
 utilizing both active and passive investment styles. These more volatile assets are balanced with less volatile assets
 primarily mutual
 co-mingled and other funds comprised of fixed income securities. Professional investment firms are engaged to provide advice on the selection and monitoring of investment funds
 and to provide advice on the allocation of plan assets across the various fund managers. This advice is based in part on the duration of each plan&amp;#8217;s liability. The investment return performances are evaluated quarterly against specific benchmark indices and against a peer group of funds of the same asset classification.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;The allocations of U.S. pension plan assets as of November 30
 by asset category
 were as follows:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;div style=padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td colspan=7 rowspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=width:61%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;As of November 30


 venture capital and limited partnerships. The net asset is based on valuation models of the underlying securities as determined by the general partner or general partner's designee. These valuation models include unobservable inputs that cannot be corroborated using verifiable observable market data. These funds typically have redemption periods of approximately 10 years. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=width:26px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:8pt;padding-left:2px;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;(l)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;This category comprises limited partnerships funds investing in senior loans
 mezzanine and distressed debt. The net asset is based on valuation models of the underlying securities as determined by the general partner or general partner's designee. These valuation models include unobservable inputs that cannot be corroborated using verifiable observable market data. These funds typically have redemption periods of approximately 10 years. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;For the plans&amp;#8217; hedge funds
 private equity funds and private debt funds
 we engage an independent advisor to compare the funds&amp;#8217; returns to other funds with similar strategies. Each fund is required to have an annual audit by an independent accountant
 which is provided to the independent advisor. This provides a basis of comparability relative to similar assets.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;Equity securities in the U.S. plan included McCormick stock with a fair value of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$39.0 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; (&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;0.4 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; shares and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;6.0%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of total U.S. pension plan assets) and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$35.3 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; (&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;0.4 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; shares and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;6.3%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of total U.S. pension plan assets) at &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;November 30
 2017&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;2016&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 respectively. Dividends paid on these shares were &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$0.7 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; in &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;2017&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and in &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;2016&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;Pension benefit payments in our most significant plans are made from assets of the pension plans. It is anticipated that future benefit payments for the U.S. and International plans for the next 10 fiscal years will be as follows:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;div style=padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td colspan=7 rowspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=width:66%; rowspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;17.0&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;2023-2027&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td colspan=2 style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px; rowspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;237.0&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td colspan=2 style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px; rowspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;94.3&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#00539b;font-weight:bold;&gt;U.S. Defined Contribution Retirement Plans&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;For the U.S. defined contribution retirement plan
 we match &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;100%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of a participant&amp;#8217;s contribution up to the first &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;3%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of the participant&amp;#8217;s salary
 and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;50%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of the next &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;2%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of the participant&amp;#8217;s salary. In addition
 we make contributions of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;3%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of the participant's salary for U.S. employees not covered by the defined benefit plan. Some of our smaller U.S. subsidiaries sponsor separate 401(k) retirement plans. Our contributions charged to expense under all 401(k) retirement plans were &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$12.2 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$10.4 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$9.5 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; in &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;2017&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;2016&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;2015&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 respectively.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;At the participant&amp;#8217;s election
 401(k) retirement plans held &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;1.9 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; shares of McCormick stock
 with a fair value of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$196.6 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 at &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;November 30
 2017&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;. Dividends paid on these shares in &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;2017&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; were &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$3.8 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#00539b;font-weight:bold;&gt;Postretirement Benefits Other Than Pensions&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;We currently provide postretirement medical and life insurance benefits to certain U.S. employees who were covered under the active employees&amp;#8217; plan and retire after age &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;55&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; with at least &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;five&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; years of service. The subsidy provided under these plans is based primarily on age at date of retirement. These benefits are not pre-funded but paid as incurred. Employees hired after December&amp;#160;31
 2008 are not eligible for a company subsidy. They are eligible for coverage on an access-only basis.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;During 2017
 we made the following changes to our postretirement medical and life insurance benefits impacting certain U.S. employees:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=width:50px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:26px;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#8226;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;On August 23
 2017
 our Management Committee approved changes to our postretirement medical benefits plan for eligible U.S. employees and retirees (employees hired after December 31
 2008 are not eligible for the subsidy).&amp;#160;These changes included consolidating benefits providers and simplifying and reducing our subsidy for postretirement medical benefits. The effective date of the change in our subsidy is January 1
 2018.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=width:50px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:26px;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#8226;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;On August 23
 2017
 our Management Committee approved the elimination of life insurance benefits under our other postretirement benefit plan to eligible U.S. active employees (that life insurance benefit was available to U.S. employees hired on or prior to December 31
 2008). The effective date of this plan amendment is January 1
 2018
 unless an employee commits to their retirement date by December 31
 2017 and retires on or before December 31
 2018.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;As a result of these changes
 we remeasured the other postretirement benefit obligation as of August 23
 2017
 resulting in a reduction of the other postretirement benefit obligation of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$27.1 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;.&amp;#160;These remeasurements resulted in an aggregate non-cash
 pre-tax net prior service cost credit of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$27.1 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 which is included in our consolidated statement of comprehensive income for 2017
 as a component of Other comprehensive income (loss) on the line entitled Unrealized components of pension and other postretirement plans. Deferred taxes associated with these aggregate prior service cost credits
 together with other unrealized components of pension plans recognized during 2017
 are also included in that statement as a component of Other comprehensive income (loss). &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;Our other postretirement benefit expense follows:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;div style=padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td colspan=10 rowspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=width:61%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;3.4&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;background-color:#e0e3f1;border-top:1px solid #00539b; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;6.5&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;border-top:1px solid #00539b; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;border-top:1px solid #00539b; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;border-top:1px solid #00539b; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;6.8&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;border-top:1px solid #00539b; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;Rollforwards of the benefit obligation
 fair value of plan assets and a reconciliation of the plans&amp;#8217; funded status at November&amp;#160;30
 the measurement date

 respectively.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;For 2017


 we sponsor defined contribution plans in the U.S.&amp;#160;We contribute to defined contribution plans in locations outside the U.S.
 including government-sponsored retirement plans. We also currently provide postretirement medical and life insurance benefits to certain U.S. employees and retirees.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;We recognize the overfunded or underfunded status of our defined benefit pension plans as an asset or a liability in the balance sheet


 Plant and Equipment&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;Property
 plant and equipment is stated at historical cost and depreciated over its estimated useful life using the straight-line method for financial reporting and both accelerated and straight-line methods for tax reporting. The estimated useful lives range from &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;20&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;50&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; years for buildings and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;3&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;12&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; years for machinery
 equipment and computer software. Repairs and maintenance costs are expensed as incurred.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;We also capitalize costs of software developed or obtained for internal use. Capitalized software development costs include only (1)&amp;#160;direct costs paid to others for materials and services to develop or buy the software
 (2)&amp;#160;payroll and payroll-related costs for employees who work directly on the software development project and (3)&amp;#160;interest costs while developing the software. Capitalization of these costs stops when the project is substantially complete and ready for use. Software is amortized using the straight-line method over a range of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;3&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; to &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;8&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; years
 but not exceeding the expected life of the product. We capitalized &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$12.8 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;$21.8 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;$9.4 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of software development costs during 2017
 2016 and 2015

of special charges
 with an after-tax impact of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$2.5 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and a per share impact of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$0.02&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; for both basic and diluted earnings per share. Operating income for the second quarter of 2017 included &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$4.7 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of special charges
 with an after-tax impact of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$3.4 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and a per share impact of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$0.03&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; for both basic and diluted earnings per share. Operating income for the third quarter of 2017 included &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$4.7 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of special charges
 with an after-tax impact of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$3.2 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and a per share impact of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$0.03&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; for both basic and diluted earnings per share. Operating income for the third quarter of 2017 included &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$30.4 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of transaction and integration expenses
 including &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$5.9 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; reflected in gross profit. Net income for the third quarter of 2017 also included a pre-tax charge of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$15.4 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; reflected in other debt costs. For the third quarter of 2017
 the after-tax impact of transaction and integration expenses and other debt costs was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$31.1 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and a per share impact of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$0.25&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$0.24&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; for basic and diluted earnings per share
 respectively. Operating income for the fourth quarter of 2017 included &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$9.2 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of special charges
 with an after-tax impact of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$6.7 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and a per share impact of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$0.05&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; for both basic and diluted earnings per share. Operating income for the fourth quarter of 2017 included &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$31.3 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of transaction and integration expenses
 including &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$15.0 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; reflected in gross profit
 with an after-tax impact of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$22.4 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and a per share impact of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$0.17&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; for both basic and diluted earnings per share. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;Operating income for the first quarter of 2016 included &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$1.6 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of special charges
 with an after-tax impact of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$1.3 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and a per share impact of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$0.01&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; for both basic and diluted earnings per share. Operating income for the second quarter of 2016 included &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$3.9 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of special charges
 with an after-tax impact of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$2.7 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and a per share impact of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$0.02&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; for both basic and diluted earnings per share. Operating income for the third quarter of 2016 included &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$4.3 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of special charges
 with an after-tax impact of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$3.4 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and a per share impact of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$0.03&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; for both basic and diluted earnings per share. Operating income for the fourth quarter of 2016 included &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$6.2 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of special charges
 including &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$0.3 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; reflected in gross profit
 with an after-tax impact of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$3.7 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and a per share impact of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$0.03&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; for both basic and diluted earnings per share. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;See notes 2 and 3 for details with respect to the transaction and integration expenses and actions undertaken in connection with these special charges
 respectively.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-bottom:13px;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;Earnings per share are computed independently for each of the quarters presented. Therefore

443.9&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;background-color:#e0e3f1; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;1
054.0&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-left:12px;text-align:left;padding-left:20px;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=width:20px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:8pt;padding-left:-4px;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;(1)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;Interest rate swaps
 settled upon the issuance of these notes in 2007
 effectively set the interest rate on the &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;$250 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt; notes at a weighted-average fixed rate of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;6.25%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=width:20px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:8pt;padding-left:-4px;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;(2)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;As more fully described below
 the term loans are prepayable in whole or in-part. Also
 the term loan due in 2022 requires quarterly principal payments of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;2.5%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt; of the initial principal amount.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=width:20px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:8pt;padding-left:-4px;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;(3)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;Interest rate swaps
 settled upon the issuance of these notes in 2011
 effectively set the interest rate on the &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;$250 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt; notes at a weighted-average fixed rate of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;color:#000000;text-decoration:none;&gt;4.01%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=width:20px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:8pt;padding-left:-4px;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;(4)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;Interest rate swaps
 settled upon the issuance of these notes in 2013
 effectively set the interest rate on the &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-transform:default;&gt;$250 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt; notes at a weighted-average fixed rate of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:normal;text-transform:default;&gt;3.30%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=width:20px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:8pt;padding-left:-4px;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;(5)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;Interest rate swaps
 settled upon  the issuance of these notes in 2015
 effectively set the interest rate on the &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;$250 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt; notes at a weighted-average fixed rate of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;3.45%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:8pt;&gt;. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;The fixed interest rate on &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;$100 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt; of the &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;3.25%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt; notes due in 2025 is effectively converted to a variable rate by interest rate swaps through 2025. Net interest payments are based on 3 month LIBOR plus &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;1.22%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt; during this period (our effective rate as of November&amp;#160;30
 2017 was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;2.64%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;).&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;/table&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=width:20px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:8pt;padding-left:-4px;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;(6)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;Interest rate swaps
 settled upon the issuance of these notes in 2017

 all of which are all recorded at fair value:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;div style=padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td colspan=15 rowspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=width:22%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:13%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:1%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:11%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:1%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:1%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:11%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:1%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:13%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:1%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:11%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:1%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:1%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:11%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width:1%; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;background-color:#e0e3f1;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;As of&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;November&amp;#160;30

rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px; 296.3&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;Long-lived assets&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td colspan=2 style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px; rowspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;1
462.2&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td colspan=2 style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px; rowspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;871.9&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td colspan=2 style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px; rowspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;415.7&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td colspan=2 style=vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:2px solid #00539b;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px; rowspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:right;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;2

	

 we entered into a &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;&gt;15&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;&gt;-year lease for a headquarters building in Hunt Valley
 Maryland. The lease
 which is expected to commence upon completion of building construction and fit-out
 currently scheduled for the second half of 2018
 requires monthly lease payments of approximately &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;&gt;$0.9 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;&gt; beginning six months after lease commencement. The &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;&gt;$0.9 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;&gt; monthly lease payment is subject to adjustment after an initial &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;&gt;60&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;&gt;-month period and thereafter on an annual basis as specified in the lease agreement. In addition
 the initial &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;&gt;$0.9 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:9pt;&gt; monthly lease payment is subject to increase in the event of agreed-upon changes to specifications related to the headquarters building. We expect to consolidate our Corporate staff and certain non-manufacturing U.S. employees
 currently housed in four locations in the suburban Baltimore
 Maryland area
 to the new headquarters building. Due to uncertainty as to the exact date when the lease will commence
 these lease payments are not reflected in the preceding table of annual fixed rental payments for the years ending November 30

697.5 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$848.8 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of goodwill to the consumer segment and industrial segment
 respectively. We acquired Giotti in December 2016 (see note 2). We completed the final valuation of the acquired net assets of Giotti during the fourth quarter of 2017 which resulted in the allocation of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$80.5 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of goodwill to the industrial segment. During fiscal 2017
 we also finalized the purchase accounting for our 2016 acquisitions of Gourmet Garden and Cajun Injector

 2018 are as follows (in millions):&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;div style=padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td colspan=4 rowspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=width:91%; of special charges
 with an after-tax impact of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$2.5 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and a per share impact of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$0.02&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; for both basic and diluted earnings per share. Operating income for the second quarter of 2017 included &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$4.7 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of special charges
 with an after-tax impact of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$3.4 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and a per share impact of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$0.03&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; for both basic and diluted earnings per share. Operating income for the third quarter of 2017 included &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$4.7 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of special charges
 with an after-tax impact of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$3.2 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and a per share impact of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$0.03&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; for both basic and diluted earnings per share. Operating income for the third quarter of 2017 included &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$30.4 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of transaction and integration expenses
 including &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$5.9 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; reflected in gross profit. Net income for the third quarter of 2017 also included a pre-tax charge of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$15.4 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; reflected in other debt costs. For the third quarter of 2017
 the after-tax impact of transaction and integration expenses and other debt costs was &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$31.1 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and a per share impact of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$0.25&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$0.24&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; for basic and diluted earnings per share
 respectively. Operating income for the fourth quarter of 2017 included &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$9.2 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of special charges
 with an after-tax impact of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$6.7 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and a per share impact of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$0.05&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; for both basic and diluted earnings per share. Operating income for the fourth quarter of 2017 included &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$31.3 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of transaction and integration expenses
 including &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$15.0 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; reflected in gross profit
 with an after-tax impact of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$22.4 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and a per share impact of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$0.17&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; for both basic and diluted earnings per share. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;Operating income for the first quarter of 2016 included &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$1.6 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of special charges
 with an after-tax impact of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$1.3 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and a per share impact of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$0.01&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; for both basic and diluted earnings per share. Operating income for the second quarter of 2016 included &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$3.9 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of special charges
 with an after-tax impact of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$2.7 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and a per share impact of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$0.02&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; for both basic and diluted earnings per share. Operating income for the third quarter of 2016 included &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$4.3 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of special charges
 with an after-tax impact of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$3.4 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and a per share impact of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$0.03&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; for both basic and diluted earnings per share. Operating income for the fourth quarter of 2016 included &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$6.2 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of special charges
 including &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$0.3 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; reflected in gross profit
 with an after-tax impact of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$3.7 million&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and a per share impact of &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;$0.03&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; for both basic and diluted earnings per share. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;See notes 2 and 3 for details with respect to the transaction and integration expenses and actions undertaken in connection with these special charges
 respectively.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;br clear=none/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-bottom:13px;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;Earnings per share are computed independently for each of the quarters presented. Therefore

rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;Deducted from asset accounts:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td colspan=3 style=vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px; rowspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td colspan=3 style=vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px; rowspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td colspan=3 style=vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px; rowspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td colspan=3 style=vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px; rowspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td colspan=3 style=vertical-align:bottom;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px; rowspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=overflow:hidden;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=vertical-align:top;padding-left:12px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px; rowspan=1 colspan=1&gt;&lt;div style=text-align:left;font-size:8pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:8pt;&gt;Year ended November&amp;#160;30


 market and distribute spices
 seasoning mixes
 condiments and other flavorful products throughout the world. Our consumer segment sells to retail channels
 including grocery
 mass merchandise
 warehouse clubs
 discount and drug stores
 and e-commerce under the &amp;#8220;McCormick&amp;#8221; brand and a variety of brands around the world
 including &amp;#8220;French's
&amp;#8221; &amp;#8220;Frank's RedHot
&amp;#8221; &amp;#8220;Lawry&amp;#8217;s
&amp;#8221; &amp;#8220;Zatarain&amp;#8217;s
&amp;#8221; &amp;#8220;Simply Asia
&amp;#8221; &amp;#8220;Thai Kitchen
&amp;#8221; &amp;#8220;Ducros
&amp;#8221; &amp;#8220;Vahin&amp;#233;
&amp;#8221; &amp;#8220;Schwartz
&amp;#8221; &amp;#8220;Club House
&amp;#8221; &amp;#8220;Kamis
&amp;#8221; &amp;#8220;Kohinoor
&amp;#8221; DaQiao, Drogheria &amp;amp; Alimentari, Stubb's and Gourmet Garden. Our industrial segment sells to food manufacturers and the foodservice industry both directly and indirectly through distributors.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;In each of our segments
 we produce and sell many individual products which are similar in composition and nature. With their primary attribute being flavor
 we regard the products within each of our segments to be fairly homogenous. It is impracticable to segregate and identify sales and profits for each of these individual product lines.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;Historically we have measured segment performance based on operating income excluding special charges as this activity is managed separately from the business segments. Beginning in 2017
 we also are excluding transaction and integration expenses related to our acquisition of RB Foods from our measure of segment performance as these expenses are similarly managed separately from the business segments. These transaction and integration expenses excluded from our segment performance measure include the amortization of the acquisition-date fair value adjustment of inventories that is included in cost of goods sold
 costs directly associated with that acquisition and costs associated with integrating the RB Foods business. Although the segments are managed separately due to their distinct distribution channels and marketing strategies
 manufacturing and warehousing are often integrated to maximize cost efficiencies. We do not segregate jointly utilized assets by individual segment for internal reporting
 evaluating performance or allocating capital. Because of manufacturing integration for certain products within the segments
 products are not sold from one segment to another but rather inventory is transferred at cost. Intersegment sales are not material.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;We have a large number of customers for our products. Sales to one of our consumer segment customers
 Wal-Mart Stores
 Inc.
 accounted for &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;11%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of consolidated sales in &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;2017&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;2016&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;2015&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;. Sales to one of our industrial segment customers
 PepsiCo
 Inc.
 accounted for &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;11%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; of consolidated sales in &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;2017&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;
 &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;2016&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt; and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;2015&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;&gt;Accounting policies for measuring segment operating income and assets are consistent with those described in note 1. Because of integrated manufacturing for certain products within the segments
 products are not sold from one segment to another but rather inventory is transferred at cost. Inter-segment sales are not material. Corporate assets include cash
 deferred taxes
 investments and certain fixed assets.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;font style=font-family:Arial;font-size:10pt;color:#00539b;font-weight:bold;&gt;Business Segment Results&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/div&gt;&lt;div style=line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;&gt;&lt;div style=padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;&gt;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10pt;width:100%;border-collapse:collapse;text-align:left;&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td colspan=16 rowspan=1&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&lt;tr&gt;&lt;td style=width:40%;
